monster.name: Cannoneer Guardian

ac.condition: when Core of the Guardian is active

walk.condition: (30 ft. when Core of the Guardian is active)

languages: Understands commands in any language but can't speak

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The guardian regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point when Core of the Guardian isn't active.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: When Core of the Guardian is active, a creature that touches the guardian or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Core of the Guardain (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
entries: When the guardian is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, the damage destroys its heavy armor plates, revealing its burning arcane core, the guardian regains 218 hit points and moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.. While this trait is active the guardian has an AC of 16, a base walking speed of 30 ft., gains the Heated Body trait and loses the Regeneration trait. If it finishes a short or long rest, the guardian repairs its armor and loses this trait.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guardian makes two attack.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cannon
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The guardian makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Fist
entries: The guardian makes a fist attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The guardian moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

mythicHeader: If the guardian's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Core of the Guardian.

mythic.name: Scorching Burst (costs 3 actions)
entries: The guardian points Its cannon and 30 ft. cone of arcane fire erupts from it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage. The guardian can't use the cannon attack until the end of it's next turn

mythic.name: Quake Slam (costs 2 action)
entries: The guardian slams its foot on the ground, creating a strong tremor. Each creature in a 10 ft. radius must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The caurtoska has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: With the DM's permission, the {@spell find familiar} spell can summon a tilpan.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The tilpan has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the arboreobug remains motionless with its body buried underground, it is indistinguishable from a tree.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The arboreobug has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arboreobug makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The bismut bull's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). The bismut bullcan innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The bismut bull can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 feet of it that can understand a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bismut bull makes two claw attacks

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The gnilvory has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the gnilvory to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the gnilvory drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crystalling can innately cast {@spell dancing lights}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crystalling can innately cast {@spell dancing lights}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crystalling is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Stone Resilience
entries: The crystalling has advantage on saving throws against poison,  as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Earth Walk
entries: Moving through difficult terrain made of earth or stone costs the crystalling no extra movement.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Stone Abjuration (1/long rest)
entries: The crystalling hurls the power of the earth to protect his kind in battle. For 10 minutes, the crystals on the skin of up to three crystallings within the shaman grow and harden, giving them extra defence against physical blows. For the duration, the targets gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from non-magical attacks.

reaction.name: Semi-reflective Crystals (3/long rest)
entries: When the crystalling take damage from a line spell or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, it can attempt to redirect the magical energy against a target within 60 feet of them. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failure the target takes radiant damage equal to {@damage 1d8 + 5}

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the angassik can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hawkmoth is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The hawkmoth has the following bard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hawkmoth's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The hawkmoth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hawkmoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Chant of Good Luck (1/day)
entries: The hawkmoth whispers its chant, that takes 10 minutes to perform. When the song ends every creature within 30 feet of the hawkmoth must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom Saving Throw or fall {@condition unconscious}. A creature can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be affected. After 4 hours the affected creatures wake up getting all the benefits of a long rest. Furthermore, the creatures gains a +2 bonus to all ability checks and saving throws, including Death Saving Throws. These benefits last for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hawkmoth makes four spell attacks.

action.name: Ethereal Rapier
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) radiant damage.

action.name: Moonlight dart
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nightshade wyvern has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the Nightshade Wyvern has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightshade wyvern makes three attacks: one with it's bite and two with it's claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Umbreal Dive {@recharge 5}
entries: If the nightshade wyvern is flying and dives at least 50 feet straight toward the ground, it can use this action. The nightshade wyvern then moves 60 feet in any direction, forming a 60 feet long and 20 feet wide area and without expending movement. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Ethereal Nightshade Wyvern
entries: Sometimes a nightshade wyvern shows a stronger Shadowfell influence, being able to manifest a partial etherealness.

An ethereal nightshade wyvern is a normal nightshade wyvern with a challenge rate of 11 (7,200 XP), immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from non-magical attacks, and the following additional trait:

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the Nightshade Wyvern can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The infgoblin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the infgoblin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Tactical Cowardice
entries: As a bonus action, the infgoblin raidchief can move up to its speed away from a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The infgoblin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the infgoblin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) damage.

monster.name: Rock-o'-Wisp
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Consume Life
entries: As a bonus action, the rock-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The rock-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rock-o'-wisp makes two rock attacks.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 15/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The rock-o'-wisp and its light magically become {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).
Will-o'-wisps are malevolent, wispy balls of light that haunt lonely places and battlefields, bound by dark fate or dark magic to feed on fear and despair.

entries.name: Hope and Doom
entries: Will-o'-wisps look like bobbing lantern lights in the distance, although they can choose to alter their colors, or wink out completely. When they activate their lights, will-o'-wisps offer hope, hinting of safety to creatures that follow them.

Will-o'-wisps lure unwary creatures into quicksand pits, monster lairs, and other dangerous places so that they can feed on the suffering of their prey and revel in their death screams. An evil being that falls prey to a will-o'-wisp might become a wisp itself, its woeful spirit coalescing above its lifeless corpse like a flickering flame.

entries.name: Consumed by Despair
entries: Will-o'-wisps are the souls of evil beings that perished in anguish or misery as they wandered forsaken lands permeated with powerful magic. They thrive in swampy bogs and bone-strewn battlefields where the oppressive weight of sorrow stoops even heavier than the low-hanging mist and fog. Trapped in these desolate places of lost hope and memory, will-o'-wisps lure other creatures toward dismal fates and feed on their misery.

entries.name: Agents of Evil
entries: Will-o'-wisps rarely speak, but when they do, their voices sound like faint or distant whispers. In the miserable domains they haunt, will-o'-wisps sometimes form symbiotic relationships with their wicked neighbors. Hags, oni, black dragons, and evil cultists work with will-o'-wisps to draw creatures into ambush. As their evil allies surround and slaughter creatures, the wisps hover above them, drinking the agony of a last breath and savoring the sensation as the light of life goes out in a creature's eyes.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A will-o'-wisp doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the nebgoblin can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the nebgoblin can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The nebgoblin makes two scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage in melee, or 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage at range.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The scout has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The groukangler can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Lightning Frenzy
entries: Whenever the groukangler is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead moves a number of feet equal to the lightning damage dealt without provocking opportunity attacks, and it also gains a number of temporary hit points equal to half that amount.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The groukangler makes two bites attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Shocking Burst {@recharge 6}
entries: The groukangler releases the static electricity that runs within its body in a burst of lightning, all around its body.

Every creature in a 20-foot sphere centered on the groukangler must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Flash {@recharge 4}
entries: The quartz beetle flashes with bright light in attempt to blind an aggressor. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hobgoblin is an 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the hobgoblin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the hobgoblin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hobgoblin's unarmed strikes are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack. It can also use Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: The hobgoblin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it is leaving and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

reaction.name: Deflect Projectile
entries: When the hobgoblin is hit by a ranged weapon attack, it can use it's reaction to reduce the damage by {@damage 1d10 + 4}.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Telepathic Link
entries: The raven can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communcate telepathically.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nightshade griffon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nightshade griffon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the nightshade griffon has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightshade griffon makes three attacks: two with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Ethereal Nightshade Griffon
entries: Sometimes a nightshade griffon shows a stronger Shadowfell influence, being able to manifest a partial etherealness.

An ethereal nightshade griffon is a nightshade griffon with a challenge rate of 7 (2,900 XP), immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from non-magical attacks, and the following additional trait:

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the nightshade griffon can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nightshade pegasus's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). The bismut bullcan innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nightshade pegasus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the nightshade pegasus has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Umbreal Wind {@recharge 5}
entries: The nightshade pegasus beats its wings. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating in front of the nightshade pegasus must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The nightshade pegasus can then fly up to half its flying speed.

variant.name: Ethereal Nightshade Pegasus
entries: Sometimes a nightshade pegasus shows a stronger Shadowfell influence, being able to manifest a partial etherealness.

An ethereal nightshade pegasus is a nightshade pegasus with a challenge rate of 7 (2,900 XP), immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from non-magical attacks, and the following additional trait:

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the nightshade pegasus can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The nightshade owlbear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nightshade owlbear has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the nightshade owlbear has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightshade owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Ethereal Nightshade Owlbear
entries: Sometimes a nightshade owlbear shows a stronger Shadowfell influence, being able to manifest a partial etherealness.

An ethereal nightshade owlbear is a nightshade owlbear with a challenge rate of 9 (5,000 XP), immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from non-magical attacks, and the following additional trait:

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the nightshade pegasus can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The borderwatcher specialist is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The borderwatcher specialist has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.
